name: incommunicable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(also uncommunicable, uk/ˌʌn.kəˈmjuː.nɪ.kə.bəl/ us/ˌʌn.kəˈmjuː.nə.kə.bəl/) An incommunicable idea cannot be expressed or explained to someone else: incommunicable to Their experiences of war were largely incommunicable to those at home. It could be said that feelings of love are incommunicable. The central reality of war is an uncommunicable horror.
An incommunicable disease cannot be passed from one person to another: Coronary artery disease is the most common cause of mortality from incommunicable disease in the world. Synonym
non-communicable
More examplesFewer examplesWe have shared the incommunicable experience of war.It's an alternative way to write intensely about incommunicable emotions.Over the past few decades, diabetes has emerged as an important incommunicable disease in sub-Saharan Africa.
